actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-45, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H. Con. Res. 106 with 5 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. Two hours of general debate shall be confined to the subject of economic goals and policies. It shall be in order to consider an amendment if offered by the Committee on the Budget, debatable for not more than thirty minutes and not subject to amendment. No further amendments shall be in order except the amendments printed in the report accompanying this resolution. Said amendments shall not be subject to amendment and shall be in order even if a previous amendment in the nature of a substitute has been adopted. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. All points of order against said amendments shall be waived. If more than one of the amendments in the nature of a substitute is adopted, ...
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 17.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 106) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal years 1990, 1991, and 1992.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H. Con. Res. 106 (congressional budget).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 106) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal years 1990, 1991, and 1992.
